comments:
I have a report that includes some artwork (.jpg files).  In IE, they appear correctly.  In Firefox 1.5, they do NOT appear at all.

Also, in both cases I get error messages:

Can you also try it in firefox 1.0? this version is our current suported version.

he error message that you see is caused by onCreate script defined for one of the image elements (id 14 in the report design):
  report.design.images["CMBP.jpg"]
This is not a valid JS expression. Did you enter that by mistake?

For the Firefox issue: The html files that you attached have references to these image files:
C:\DOCUME~1\lorenz\LOCALS~1\Temp\file2850.img
C:\DOCUME~1\lorenz\LOCALS~1\Temp\file2851.img

Are these the intended locations of the image files? At the time of the error did  you verify that these images are indeed there? Do these images show up if you open them directly in Firefox?

If answer is Yes to all questions, also try generating the image URIs in this form: 
file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Local%20Settings/Temp/file2850.img

Are you viewing report using web viewer or viewing report as HTML?   And do you use the report viewer JSP pages as it is , or you have customized them.

I have tried Firefox 1.5 to view report as HTML, and it works for report with images.

thanks

(In reply to comment #7)
> Are you viewing report using web viewer or viewing report as HTML?   And do you
> use the report viewer JSP pages as it is , or you have customized them.
> 
> I have tried Firefox 1.5 to view report as HTML, and it works for report with
> images.
> 
> thanks
> 
I am opening the HTML output file by double clicking it.  I don't use the BIRT viewer because it doesn't work.  I have not done any customization that I know of - what is an example?

Thanks for your help.  Mark
The file based HTML result should use "file://" URL to refer the images.

Do you set the imageDirectory of HTMLRenderContext? The imageDirectory is used to store the created image files. If the imageDirectory is a absolute path, the report engine creats a absolute file path for you which is not supported by the Firefox. 

You can use a relative folder as the image folder,such as "./workspace/imagefolder" as the workaround.

(In reply to comment #10)
> Do you set the imageDirectory of HTMLRenderContext? The imageDirectory is used
> to store the created image files. 
> You can use a relative folder as the image folder,such as
> "./workspace/imagefolder" as the workaround.
> 
I was not setting the context at all - once I did, it worked in Firefox!
Thanks!
